text: I turned 30 on Tuesday.

And in doing so, I had outlived
the average life expectancy

for a transgender man,
which is 29.5 years old.

My name is Ivan, and I
wouldn't be on this stage

if I didn't spend
hundreds of hours
seeking gender-affirming care.

It took hundreds of hours
because only 1 in 4 clinicians

know how to treat
transgender patients,

and so I was spending
time educating

the very people
who were supposed
to know how to care for me.

I could only do that because
I was a health care management
consultant for seven years.

It was literally my
living to talk to doctors
and analyze clinical data.

My story is simply
not the reality

for the 1.6 million transgender
individuals in the United
States.

The fact is informed
clinicians save lives,

and that is why I founded Trans
Health HQ, a one-stop shop

for health care teams
that centralizes resources

around gender-affirming care so
that every clinician is equipped

to treat and advocate
for their trans patients.

We have hundreds
of active users,

a growing wait
list, partnerships

with major hospitals
and insurance companies

to launch to our first
10,000 doctors this year.

Your support enables a
trans-led intervention

to change the lives
of millions so

that everybody in our
community can also live
to see their 30th birthday.
